roleset.name: comprise
roleset.note: CONSTITUTE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'constitute' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No verbnet entry. Comparison to 'make_up', unfortunately unframed in this sense. (from constitute.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: constitute-v: typical usage
example.text: ...such as the 500 stocks that *trace* constitute the Standard& Poor's 500 stock index...

example.name: constitution-n
example.text: a laminate may be said to have a constitution of 30%. 0° plies, 30%+/—45o plies, and 30% 90° plies.

roleset.name: make constitutional
roleset.note: CONSTITUTIONALIZE-V NOTES: Roleset by Julia based on internet search. No Vncls. Comparison to ?legalize?. (from constitutionalize.03-v)

example.name: Agent and theme
example.text: If the people explicitly constitutionalize discrimination, such discrimination is legal.

example.name: Passive with amendment
example.text: [The innovation]-1 was constitutionalized *trace*-1 in an amendment of 1983.

example.name: Amendment as arg0
example.text: This amendment will constitutionalize the cloning of embryos for destruction in research.
example.arg: the cloning of embryos for destruction in research.

roleset.name: take a digestion-aiding walk after a meal
roleset.note: CONSTITUTIONALIZE-V NOTES: Roleset by Julia based on internet search. No Vncls. (from constitutionalize.02-v)

example.name: Intransitive
example.text: John constitutionalizes every day after dinner.

roleset.name: provide with a constitution
roleset.note: CONSTITUTIONALIZE-V NOTES: Roleset by Julia based on internet search. Member of Vncls establish-55.5. (from constitutionalize.01-v)

example.name: Both args
example.text: We are there *PRO* to constitutionalize Iraq rather than democratize Iraq.
